alert.note: Alert for Inland Harris; Montgomery; Northern Liberty (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 20 at 11:14PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Montgomery, west central Liberty and northeastern Harris Counties through 1145 PM CDT... At 1114 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Splashtown, or near Spring, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Humble, Tomball, Aldine, Kingwood, The Woodlands, Greater Greenspoint, Spring, Oak Ridge North, Shenandoah, Patton Village, Roman Forest, Woodbranch, Plum Grove, Bush Intercontinental Airport, The Woodlands Pavillion, Chateau Woods, Willowbrook, Atascocita, Hooks Airport and Lake Houston Dam. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for southeastern Texas.
